ratings.question_text: I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Did you participate in a work group as part of this course?

narratives.question_text: What is the name of your TA?
comments: Lindsay
Lindsay Soh
Lindsay Soh
Lindsay Soh
Lindsay Soh

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-10, if you wish
comments: Question 1: As the instructor is already aware, several students (myself included) were unhappy with the primary text, Zhang's Fundamentals of Environmental Sampling and Analysis. The book was poorly written - so poor, in fact, that it was clear several later chapters had been written by a non-native english speaker and then barely edited. This was disappointing and made gleaning useful knowledge from the text difficult. The optional Harris text proved to be much more useful.Apart from this criticism, I found the course extremely useful. I would highly recommend it to anyone planning to use analytical methods in his or her research at F&ES.
Some of the wet-chemistry labs could have been consolidated in the beginning of the course.

the instructor seriously lacks the necessary skills for teaching and efficient communication. Without any exaggeration, I could not understand most of what the instructor said during classes, and had to spend many more hours reading the textbook to understand the basic concept of class materials. While his skills for supervising lab sessions are superb, his teaching skills were found to be worse than the TA.
The labs and lab demos. Lectures were also very informative.
The professor's willingness to tailor the labs to student interest.
Opportunity to use many analytical instruments which will be central to my future research.

Being a lab based course, this class gave students a chance to get real hands on experience with a variety of lab techniques. This is very valuable for those interested in doing these and other analyses as it gives you at least a level of familiarity with the processes.

narratives.question_text: The things about this course most in need of improvement are:
comments: See comments above regarding the textbook.
Class lecture.
Instructor's teaching skill, or having another instructor responsible for lecture component of the class.
The lab notebook was hard to write in and tedious to hand write all the labs. I think a combination of obervations in the lab notebook with a typed report would work better!

narratives.question_text: What was the availability and quality of help you received of the instructor and TA?
comments: Both: Excellent.
The TA was extremely helpful and did a great job breaking down concepts presented in lecture that were not clear at first.
Both the instructor and TA were excellent in providing help outside class.
Both the instructor and the TA were very helpful and available. Both seemed to care about making sure we were really understanding the material.

narratives.question_text: Discuss if you wish how this course fits into your overall program.
comments: My only regret is that I did not take this course in my first year at F&ES - the first-year students in the course will benefit from the exposure to the analytical methods available for their research.
This course was invaluable for my summer research.

This class is somewhat fundamental to students who study biogeoscience, but the poor teaching skills of the instructor make it impossible for student to fully utilize the class. I suggest developing a new 4-5 credit class where another professor is responsible for more indepth lectures and the current instructor responsible for lab sessions.

This course was an excellent addition to my program. However, I do recommend taking this course in one's first year as opposed to second as it would have been nice to be aware of the chemical analyses available prior to conducting my research.

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: I wanted to gain an overview of various basic analytical methods and their possible uses in my research.
To learn the proper techniques and instruments before planning and conducting my research.
Preparation for my research
To get hands on experience with chemical analysis and gain familiarity with instruments and techniques available for a variety of analyses.

narratives.question_text: Did it live up to your expectations?
comments: Absolutely, yes.
Yes.
no
Yes, this course was actually much more interesting than I thought and far exceeded my expectations.

narratives.question_text: Did you get out of it what you expected?
comments: Yes.
Yes.
Yes, but I could have gotten more out of it.
Yes

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: My lab group: Even though we both ultimately produced our own work for the course, I found the ability to bounce ideas off a partner very useful.
We worked with partners for some experiments and in a group for one. This worked well to give everybody experience with different tasks.

narratives.question_text: For students taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: Take it in the first year of your master's or PhD program!
If you have any questions ask during the lecture or afterwards, the instructor is very willing to help and approachable.

Try to really understand the processes going on in the instruments rather than just knowing how to operate them. This class is excellent for getting a real in-depth understanding and I really recommend it!
